verses.text: 那時，摩西正在牧放他岳父米甸祭司葉忒羅的羊群。有一次，他把羊群領到曠野的盡頭去，到了 神的山，就是何烈山。

words.note: Indicates an action in progress or at a precise moment.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者從荊棘叢裡的火燄中向摩西顯現。摩西觀看，看見荊棘被火燒著，卻沒有燒毀。
摩西說：「我要到那邊去，看看這大異象，這荊棘為甚麼燒不掉？」

words.note: Reduplication of verb implies a casual or brief action.
不掉 (bùdiào) is a potential complement, meaning 'cannot be removed/fall off'.

verses.text: 耶和華見摩西要到那邊去觀看， 神就從荊棘叢裡呼叫他，說：「摩西，摩西。」摩西說：「我在這裡。」
耶和華說：「不可過到這裡來；要把你腳上的鞋脫掉，因為你所站的地方是聖地。」

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
掉 (diào) as a resultative complement implies removal or loss.

words.definition: particle indicating a passive or object
words.note: Forms a noun phrase with the following verb, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 又說：「我是你父親的 神、亞伯拉罕的 神、以撒的 神、雅各的 神。」摩西因為怕見 神，就把自己的臉蒙住了。

words.note: Refers to the one God.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「我的子民在埃及所受的痛苦，我實在看見了；他們因受督工的轄制所發的呼聲，我也聽見了；他們的痛苦，我是知道的。

words.note: The name of God in the Old Testament.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, meaning 'what is V-ed'.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, meaning 'what is V-ed'.
Adds emphasis or an explanatory tone to the preceding statement.

verses.text: 所以我下來，要救他們脫離埃及人的手，領他們脫離那地，到美好寬闊之地，到流奶與蜜之地，就是到迦南人、赫人、亞摩利人、比利洗人、希未人和耶布斯人的地方。

words.definition: to escape from, to get rid of
to escape from, to get rid of

words.note: Functions like '的' in classical or formal contexts, often for noun modification.

words.definition: land flowing with milk and honey
words.note: A biblical idiom symbolizing a land of great abundance and fertility.

verses.text: 現在以色列人的呼聲已經達到我的面前，我也看見了埃及人對他們所施的壓迫。

words.note: Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 所以現在你來，我要派你到法老那裡去，使你可以把我的人民以色列人從埃及領出來。」
摩西對 神說：「我是誰，竟能到法老那裡去，把以色列人從埃及領出來呢？」

words.note: Refers to the singular God.
Indicates direct object is placed before verb.

verses.text: 神回答：「我必與你同在；你把人民從埃及領出來的時候，你們要在這山上事奉 神；這就是我派你去的憑據。」

words.note: Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.

verses.text: 摩西對 神說：「我到以色列人那裡，對他們說：『你們祖宗的 神差遣我到你們這裡來』，他們必問我：『他叫甚麼名字？』我要對他們說甚麼呢？」

words.note: Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.

verses.text: 神回答摩西：「我是『自有永有者』。」又說：「你要對以色列人這樣說：『那自有者派我到你們這裡來。』」

words.note: Refers to the singular God.

words.definition: I AM WHO I AM, The Self-Existent One
words.note: A divine title from Exodus 3:14.
A shorter form of the divine title 'I AM'.

verses.text: 神又對摩西說：「你要對以色列人這樣說：『耶和華你們祖宗的 神，就是亞伯拉罕的 神、以撒的 神、雅各的 神，差遣我到你們這裡來；這就是我永久的名字，也是世世代代中我被記念的名字。』

words.note: Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.
Refers to the singular God.

verses.text: 你去召集以色列的長老，對他們說：『耶和華你們祖宗的 神，就是亞伯拉罕的 神、以撒的 神、雅各的 神，向我顯現，說：「我實在眷顧了你們，和鑒察了你們在埃及所遭遇的。」

words.note: Refers to a specific religious or community role.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used in the Bible to refer to the patriarchs.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
Often used for divine appearance or manifestation.

words.definition: care for, look upon with favor
words.note: Implies divine care, favor, and oversight.
Implies careful and discerning observation, often by God.
Precedes a verb to refer to the object or what happened.

verses.text: 我也曾說：「我要把你們從埃及的痛苦中領出來，到迦南人、赫人、亞摩利人、比利洗人、希未人、耶布斯人之地去，就是到流奶與蜜之地去。」』

words.note: Used as a locative suffix, indicating 'from within'.
A verb-complement compound indicating direction.
A classical Chinese particle, similar to '的'.
A biblical idiom describing a land of abundance and prosperity.
A classical Chinese particle, similar to '的'.

verses.text: 他們必聽你的話；你和以色列的長老要到埃及王那裡去，對他說：『耶和華希伯來人的 神遇見了我們。現在求你讓我們走三天的路程到曠野去，好獻祭給耶和華我們的 神。』

words.note: Refers to a specific religious or community role.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
Refers to desolate, uncultivated land, often with religious significance.
A verb-object compound for making religious offerings.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used as a proper noun for God in this context.

verses.text: 我也知道，如果不施行大能的手（「如果不施行大能的手」或譯：「雖然施行大能的手」），埃及王決不會讓你們走的。

words.note: Often refers to God's great power.

verses.text: 因此，我要伸手，用我在埃及快要施行的一切異能，擊打埃及；然後他才會讓你們離去。

words.note: Can function as a pronoun for 'everything' or adjective for 'all'.
Refers to supernatural signs and powerful acts, often divine.

verses.text: 我必叫這民在埃及人的眼前蒙恩。因此你們離去的時候，就不至於空手而去。

words.definition: before one's eyes, in front of

words.note: A verb-object compound, 'receive grace'.
Used here to form a time phrase '...的時候'.

words.definition: not come to, not result in

verses.text: 但每個婦女要向她鄰居的婦女，和寄居在她家中的婦女索取銀器、金器和衣服，要給你們的兒女穿戴；這樣，你們就把埃及人的財物掠奪了。」

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating disposal or manipulation.
Indicates completion of an action or a change of state.
